alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 6:41AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COAHOMA... SOUTHWESTERN TATE...NORTHWESTERN TALLAHATCHIE...QUITMAN AND NORTHWESTERN PANOLA COUNTIES THROUGH 715 AM CST... At 641 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Shelby, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Batesville, John W Kyle State Park, Tutwiler, Marks, Sardis, Lambert, Como, Crenshaw, Crowder, Sledge, Sumner, Belen, Vance, Darling, Pleasant Grove, Curtis Station, Falcon, Askew, Mims, and Barksdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for northwestern Mississippi.
